definition: to fail (a student)/to pawn/(of a computer or program) to crash/to stop working
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: I might have to pawn more stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我可能必须当掉更多的东西。

sentences.english: He pawned the watch Eliza had given him upon his birthday.
sentences.chinese: 他把意莱莎给他作生日礼物的金表当掉了。

sentences.english: And sometimes he didn't have the money to get back what he had pawned.
sentences.chinese: 好几次，他无钱赎回自己当掉的东西。

sentences.english: And who did the selling and the pawning?
sentences.chinese: 当掉了。“”是谁去替她卖的？

sentences.english: Pawned his wedding ring; bought drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他当掉结婚戒指去买毒品。

definition: to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to flunk (Tw)/(computing) to crash/to stop working
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
